A HUGE THANK YOU to Ms. Maddie for coordinating our first Step Up Parade!! Thank you to all our staff and families that came out to celebrate & cheer our students on!

Congratulations to all our Kindergarten & 5th graders! Enjoy your summer! We are so proud of you!!!

To our 5th graders, we wish you all the best of luck in your new path to Middle school.

To our kindergarteners, we will see you in the fall as 1st graders!!!

Ms. Rios & Principal Salvador

MLK Families, the State has just announced that we will not be returning to the school building this academic year. We will continue with our virtual learning and will be reaching out to you soon for your feedback. Together, we will make the best of this situation! Stay safe, stay home, and be well. We miss you all!

post_text:
MLK Families, I hope everyone is staying home and feeling healthy and safe. We received an update today from the Governor that schools will remain closed through May 4th as of today.

Our staff all met virtually today and we are working hard to prepare to move all our teaching and learning online for our kids and to support you. The plan is to go live with online learning on Monday, April 6th. More details will follow. As always, if you need anything, do not hesitate to reach out to any staff member. We are here, thinking of you all along with our own families, and ready to support! It takes a village - and we have a strong one! ❤️💛💚🖤💙🤍❤️
text:

Our staff all met virtually today and we are working hard to prepare to move all our teaching and learning online for our kids and to support you. The plan is to go live with online learning on Monday, April 6th. More details will follow. As always, if you need anything, do not hesitate to reach out to any staff member. We are here, thinking of you all along with our own families, and ready to support! It takes a village - and we have a strong one! ❤️💛💚🖤💙🤍❤️

post_text:
Good Evening MLK Families,

Thank you to all families that came today to pick up your student's packets! The turn out was fantastic!

For families that were not able to make it, packets were dropped off at the post office today. Please keep an eye out for them in the mail. While this work is not a substitute for in-school learning, we hope that it helps students maintain their learning routines. We recommend students working on their packet for 1-2 hours per day independently. This work will be collected back and graded by teachers. Teachers will be available through ClassDojo for support.

CURRENT SCHOOL STATUS: NO SCHOOL THROUGH MONDAY, APRIL 6TH (SCHOOL WILL REOPEN TUESDAY, APRIL 7TH DEPENDING ON THE PUBLIC HEALTH SITUATION AT THAT TIME.)

For questions: (please use ClassDojo or email when possible!)

Be Safe & Healthy!

You can pick up work packets today between 11:45a-12:45p. We encourage you to pick up work if possible. If not, we will be mailing all packets that aren't picked up today.

This work will be collected back and graded by teachers. Teachers will be available through Class Dojo for support.

The Martin Luther King Jr. holiday on Jan. 20, 2020, marked the 25th anniversary of the day of service that celebrates the Civil Rights leader's life and legacy.

Student in grades K-5 wrote thank you cards to the following local agencies. In total MLK Students sent over 350 cards into the community.
- Mayor Domenic Sarno
- City Council at Large
- Police
- Fire
- Animal Shelters
- Nursing Homes
- Bus Drivers
- BHN Crisis
- School Committee
- First Student
- Open Pantry

post_text:
MLK Families,

A reminder that Friday is Pajama Day & A Half Day at MLK!

Just a few rules, if you choose to participate:
• No slippers, blankets, or stuffed animals
• Night gowns must have pants underneath
• No tank tops or spaghetti straps
• Please wear school appropriate shoes for
safety.
• Choose pajamas that are appropriate for the
weather.

Please make sure that the pajamas fit appropriately for movement and activity at school. Sweats or other comfortable school-appropriate clothing is just fine as well!

Dismissal will begin promptly at 11:55a. All dismissal changes for Dec. 20th must be submitted through PikMyKid by 11:15a.

post_text:
MLK Families,

December 20th is scheduled to be a Half-Day.

Please mark your calendars with these important details about the Holiday Break & Early Dismissal:

•The MLK Carline for pickups will begin @ 11:55a
•Buses will be departing from school campus @ 12:15p
•If your child(ren) ride an after school program van, please reach out the program to ensure that they will be providing transportation that day.

Dismissal Changes for December 20th need to put into your child(ren) PikMyKid accounts by 11:15a.

Breakfast and lunch will be served December 20th.

Holiday Break
•There will be no school from Monday, December 23rd until Wednesday, January 1st.
•School will be back in session Thursday, January 2nd.
•Additionally, there will be NO school January 6 (PD Day)

post_text:
MLK Families! Parent/Teacher Conferences and Trimester 1 Report Cards are coming up next week, Tuesday, December 10th from 2:30 - 7:15pm. It is essential for families to attend to receive your child’s report card. It is also a great opportunity for you to personally check in with each of your child’s teacher(s) and discuss their academic progress. This year, while Parent/Teacher Conferences are running, students’ work will be Showcased again in the All Purpose Room and the Book Fair will be open in the Music Room.

At Report Card Night you will be able to conference briefly with their teacher(s). In order to make sure that teachers can meet with all families, you need to sign up for an appointment time. Letters to sign up are coming home with your students today. Please complete and return to school with your child tomorrow. We will send out confirmation letters on Friday. Thank you.
text:
MLK Families! Parent/Teacher Conferences and Trimester 1 Report Cards are coming up next week, Tuesday, December 10th from 2:30 - 7:15pm. It is essential for families to attend to receive your child’s report card. It is also a great opportunity for you to personally check in with each of your child’s teacher(s) and discuss their academic progress. This year, while Parent/Teacher Conferences are running, students’ work will be Showcased again in the All Purpose Room and the Book Fair will be open in the Music Room.

At Report Card Night you will be able to conference briefly with their teacher(s). In order to make sure that teachers can meet with all families, you need to sign up for an appointment time. Letters to sign up are coming home with your students today. Please complete and return to school with your child tomorrow. We will send out confirmation letters on Friday. Thank you.

post_text:
Kindergarten teacher Karen Kemp receives 2019 Excellence in Teaching Award!

Karen Kemp has been selected by Martin Luther King, Jr. Charter School of Excellence as a 2019 Excellence in Teaching Award Winner. Ms. Kemp is a passionate educator that is committed to supporting and advocating for her students. She plans thoughtful lessons each day, works collaborate with families, develops herself as a lifelong learner, and works hard to make sure she is providing each and every one of her students with the highest quality educational experience.

Ms. Kemp will be honored at a banquet for Excellence in Teaching Award Winners at the Log Cabin in Holyoke on May 9, 2019. The program will feature a new and exciting awards presentation program that elevates and celebrates every winner.
text:
Kindergarten teacher Karen Kemp receives 2019 Excellence in Teaching Award!

Karen Kemp has been selected by Martin Luther King, Jr. Charter School of Excellence as a 2019 Excellence in Teaching Award Winner. Ms. Kemp is a passionate educator that is committed to supporting and advocating for her students. She plans thoughtful lessons each day, works collaborate with families, develops herself as a lifelong learner, and works hard to make sure she is providing each and every one of her students with the highest quality educational experience.

Ms. Kemp will be honored at a banquet for Excellence in Teaching Award Winners at the Log Cabin in Holyoke on May 9, 2019. The program will feature a new and exciting awards presentation program that elevates and celebrates every winner.

post_text:
Attention all Grades 3-5 Families:
We are offering an ELA Saturday MCAS Academy on:
- March 16th, 23rd, 30th & April 6th
- 9:00 am - 12:00 pm
- $20 for all 4 days
Students will receive small group and 1:1 instruction as well as have some fun with snacks, games, and dress down themes (pajama day, backwards day, Super Hero day). ELA MCAS is only a month away and this program will give your child the extra push they need to perform their very best!
**Registration is due this Friday, March 8th**
Space is limited. First come, first serve basis.

post_text:
Congratulations MLK Writers!!

Our 3rd, 4th, & 5th graders wrote scary stories in October and were entered into a national contest-Young Writers' Spooky Sagas. We're proud to announce that 42 of our scholars were chosen to be published in a book!!! The Library of Congress in Washington DC will receive the book as well as our school. The books will be available for purchase for $24.99. (If your child was chosen, please go to the website and give permission for publishing BY Friday, Dec 21st .They extended the date an extra week.)

- The top winner will receive a trophy and an iPad
- The runner-up will receive a $50 Amazon gift card
